author: barnabasbusa

author: parithosh
content: Testing call #16 summary can be found here: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/client-testing-call-16-december-9-2024/22137

author: 0x1984
content: Is Ethereum trying to reach a 2-hard-fork-per-year cycle starting with Pectra?

author: parithosh
content: We're going by the strategy of pushing meaningful upgrades when they're ready and we're trying to do so safely/as fast as we can. But i wouldn't say we have a hard deadline of x forks/y duration.

author: timbeiko
content: Aother thing we discussed were the <#1293956979848380529> changes propoosed by <@758579010027782144>: EL devs, please review/benchmark the changes before Thursday so we can hopefully agree to a final pricing scheme this week ðŸ˜„

author: 0x1984
content: It looks like the pipeline is setup in this way. So if Pectra ships in March, then there is a good chance Fukasa can ship in October. Delivery Cadence would be the goal I guess

author: timbeiko
content:
Better late than never, here are the compiled notes from the L1 R&D workshop before Devcon SEA: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/pull/1212

They are far from perfect, but it's our first time actually taking notes and making them public after one of these --- hopefully we keep doing it for future such workshops ðŸ™‚
